messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Fake sword
messages.msgSnippet: Pete, Sorry to hear that. Good luck trying to dispute. I don t think the seller will respect anything resembling our standard conditions, or even eBay s,
messages.messageBody:
Pete,

Sorry to hear that. Good luck trying to dispute.
I don't think the seller will respect anything
resembling our standard conditions, or even
eBay's, though. So, I hope you didn't pay too much.

This is a good starting point on gunto info:
http://home.earthlink.net/~steinrl/military.htm

And here's another good source:
http://www.h4.dion.ne.jp/~t-ohmura/gunto_002.htm

Best of luck...

Andres

messages.subject: Fake sword
messages.msgSnippet: I was one of those militaria colleors who recently has been caught up on the Ebay site. I didn t do my homework...shame on me....I recently purchased what I
messages.messageBody:
I was one of those militaria colleors who recently has been caught up
on the Ebay site. I didn't do my homework...shame on me....I recently
purchased what I thought was a Japanese shin gunto sword navy 1937. But
when it arrived from China (first hint) and the more I looked at it I
believe its a fake. So where do I start on getting pics of a real
sample of one of these to dispute the purchase.

thanks
